intro: Campylospermum serratum, commonly known as the serrated campylospermum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pink flowers that appear in clusters, typically during the warmer months. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have serrated edges, contributing to its common name. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
